articles.title: Headquarters inaugurated to implement joint declaration in S. Korea
articles.content:
Headquarters inaugurated to implement joint declaration in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, June 1 (KCNA) -- An inaugural meeting of the headquarters of the solidarity for implementing the south-north joint declaration of South Korea was reportedly held at Hongik University on May 28 to promote the June 15 grand festival for national reunification.
 Rev. Kang Bui Nam in a declaration said that the south-north joint declaration serves as a landmark for national reunification and a declaration of national independence and great national unity as well as a reunification programme common to the Korean nation which enables its members to achieve reunification by their own efforts.    
 The declaration said that the headquarters would conduct diverse practical activities to stage the grand festival and undertake anti-U.S., anti-war and anti-nuke struggle and a dynamic campaign to eliminate anti-reunification forces including Ri Hoe Chang as its immediate tasks.
